page.title: 02VILLAGE DESCRIPTION
page.content: A Description of the Village. Gawsworth is a split sight village, the older half in the south based around an old crossroads, containing the Hall and Church.The northen portion of the village,(beyond the scope of our block,) is an extension of the Macclesfield suburbs. The southern concentration has two phases of development, pre1960 and post 1960.The older development is clustered around the road junction, while the modern estate was built during the early 70s when expansion doubled the size,the old school closed and the post office moved both in new premises. There are several hamlets scattered around,Newbarn,Gandysbrook and Moss Houses. Around the Hall and Church is a small settlement of C18th houses.
